attachments.title: Student invents genius kitchen gadget to help people with 1 arm
attachments.text: The Oneware is deceptively simple, but helps people with one arm do their kitchen chores a lot more easily.
attachments.fallback: Mashable: Student invents genius kitchen gadget to help people with 1 arm

text: that’s brilliant. i have a family member who can only use one arm. the kitchen seems to have the most challenges.
reminds me of a david rakoff performance I love where he talked about his one armed can opener <http://personplacething.org/person-place-thing-episode-34-david-rakoff-part-2/>

attachments.title: Episode 35: David Rakoff, Part 2 | Person Place Thing with Randy Cohen
attachments.text: Person Place Thing with Randy Cohen is an interview show based on this idea: people are particularly engaging when they speak not directly about themselves but about something they care about. Guests talk about one person, one place, and one thing that are important to them. The result? Surprising stories from great talkers.
attachments.fallback: Episode 35: David Rakoff, Part 2 | Person Place Thing with Randy Cohen

text: did they ever mail out the slides or notes from the unconscious bias training?
